stimulusHtml:
• The residual plot has 12 data points in approximately an upside-down U formation. 
  • The first 6 data points are gradually moving up and to the right. 
  • The last 6 data points are gradually moving down and to the right. 
  • 4 of the data points are below the horizontal axis. 
  • 2 of the data points touch the horizontal axis. 
  • 6 of the data points are above the horizontal axis. 
  • Moving from left to right: 
    • The first data point is farthest to the left and starts near negative 20 on the vertical axis. 
    • The second data point is below the horizontal axis and moves up and to the right. 
    • The third data point touches the horizontal axis and moves up and to the right. 
    • The fourth, fifth, and sixth data points are above the horizontal axis as they continue to move gradually up and to the right. 
    • The sixth and seventh data points are farthest from the horizontal axis, and both approximately align with a value of 10 on the vertical axis. 
    • The seventh, eighth, and ninth data points are above the horizontal axis as they continue to move gradually down and to the right. 
    • The tenth data point touches the horizontal axis and moves down and to the right. 
    • The eleventh data point is below the horizontal axis and moves down and to the right. 
    • The twelfth data point is farthest to the right and aligns with negative 20 on the vertical axis.

​A food vendor developed a new sandwich type for sale. The vendor made estimates about the sales of the new sandwich type over time. A linear regression was used to develop a model for the sales over time. The figure shows a graph of the residuals of the linear regression. Which of the following statements about the linear regression is true?
choicesHtml: ​The linear model is not appropriate, because there is a clear pattern in the graph of the residuals.
​The linear model is not appropriate, because the graph of the residuals has more points above 0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} than below 0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}.
​The linear model is appropriate, because there is a clear pattern in the graph of the residuals.

​The linear model is appropriate, because the positive residual farthest from 0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} and the negative residual farthest from 0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} are about the same distance, although more points are above 0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} than below 0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}.
